cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast (Florida Panhandle/Alabama) by Monday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Florida Panhandle or extreme SE Alabama coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi eastward to the Florida Panhandle; Florida Keys and southern Florida coast affected by outer bands and swells
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast generally 2–4 inches for NE Florida)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Monday–Tuesday, sustained winds generally below tropical-storm strength
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the northeast Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain Monday into early Tuesday with localized totals 2–4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches
